intro: Kepa fistulosa, commonly known as the pipevine or false pipevine, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its striking, waxy leaves and clusters of fragrant, violet-blue flowers. The plant is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Its stems are tuberous and can store water, allowing it to survive in arid conditions. Kepa fistulosa is also noted for its attractive foliage, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening.
